main event: On April 9, 1955, in Oakland, California, a ground-visual observation was made of an object resembling the size of Planet Venus, observed for 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was initially reported as an aircraft hovering over the bay bridge.
The investigation authorized listed possibilities such as balloon, aircraft, and astronomical object.
The report source was a 55-year-old individual.
The observation lasted 2-3 minutes, allowing for a relatively detailed sighting.
The investigation results indicated uncertainty, with insufficient data for evaluation and an unknown conclusion.
sighted object: unidentified object, possibly a balloon or aircraft
